title: The Invisible Enemy
dialogue_disasters: The Age of Man is over. The Age of the Virus has begun!
goofs: The clones of the Doctor and Leela should have been naked when created.
Leela's antibodies create a time paradox.
The Titan relief crew kills the men they are relieving rather than just infecting them.
The TARDIS's dimensional stabilizer conveniently fits into Marius' equipment.
There are guns without triggers or holes in the barrel.
Marius's operating room is clearly a TV studio with no roof.
The first shot of the Bi-Al Foundation shows damage later caused by the shuttle crash.
When K-9 blasts a chunk out of the wall, it's obviously a pre-cut segment.
Marius's willingness to part with K-9 contradicts his statement that the dog is his 'best friend'.

continuity_notes.name: Leela
continuity_notes.description: The Doctor's companion, learning to write and operate the TARDIS.
continuity_notes.current_status: Learning new skills and assisting the Doctor

continuity_notes.name: TARDIS Control Room

continuity_notes.name: The Doctor
continuity_notes.description: Time Lord from Gallifrey with unique physiological abilities.
continuity_notes.current_status: Battling an alien virus, using self-induced cataleptic trance

continuity_notes.name: K-9
continuity_notes.description: Robotic dog created by Professor Marius as a personal data-bank and companion.
continuity_notes.current_status: Joining the Doctor and Leela as a new companion

technobabble: Professor Marius is said to be an expert in extraterrestrial pathological endomorphisms.
The Doctor has 'a symbiotic self-renewing cell structure'.
The Virus is noetic and therefore only detectable during consciousness, and feeds on 'intellectual activity'.
roots: The human interior of Richard Fleischer's Fantastic Voyage
The robots of Silent Running and Star Wars
C. S. Lewis' Out of the Silent Planet (humanity as plague)
James White's 'Sector General' stories (hospital in space with senior consultant and dog)
Late 60s/early 70s medical series like The Expert and Dr Finlay's Casebook

locations.name: Titan
locations.description: A moon of Saturn with coordinates quadrant 62, WHI 1212 9990 EX 41.
locations.current_status: Site of human activity in the year 5000

locations.name: Bi-Al Foundation
locations.description: The Centre for Alien-Biomorphology located in the asteroid belt on satellite K4067.
locations.current_status: Active research facility in the year 5000

future_history: The story takes place 'at the time of the Great Break Out' of 5000 AD, when mankind 'went leapfrogging across the galaxy like a tidal wave, or a disease'. First successful cloning experiments were carried out in 3922.
additional_notes: The episode introduces K-9, who becomes a recurring companion. The story explores concepts of cloning and miniaturization.
bottom_line: An ambitious project which has the look of a grand folly due to budget constraints and the tongue-in-cheek script. Great model work is dwarfed by the weight of the story's faults. K-9 makes a quite impressive debut, though, as with many aspects of 'The Invisible Enemy', the ideas are better than the realisation.
